intro: Brodiaea californica var. leptandra, commonly known as the slender brodiaea, is a flowering plant native to coastal regions of California. It is a member of the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its narrow, grass-like leaves and clusters of bell-shaped, white or pale pink flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. It is often found in coastal dunes and is adapted to the dry, windy conditions of its habitat. This species is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological importance in supporting local pollinators.
